full_summary:
### Invitation to Qualify

#### Replacement of 30-meter Section of the Break Wall at St. Clair National Wildlife Area

**Contract Reference**: cb-638-93508713

**Invitation Type**: Invitation to Qualify (ITQ)

**Estimated Value**: CAD $300,000 - $400,000

**Project Location**: St. Clair National Wildlife Area, Pain Court, Ontario

The Government of Canada, represented by the Environment and Climate Change Canada, is inviting qualified contractors to submit their qualifications for the replacement of a 30-meter section of the break wall at St. Clair National Wildlife Area.

**Project Overview**
The project involves the removal and replacement of a 30-meter section of the existing break wall, comprising metal sheet piling, at the St. Clair National Wildlife Area. The successful contractor will be required to obtain all necessary permits and approvals, including those under the Canada Wildlife Act and the Species at Risk Act. A biologist will be required to assist with permit preparation and to be on-site during construction to ensure the implementation of environmental mitigation measures.

**Scope of Work**
The scope of work includes:
* Removal of the existing 30-meter section of the break wall
* Design and installation of new metal sheet piling
* Completion of all necessary environmental mitigation measures
* Compliance with federal regulations and permits

**Pre-requisites**
The successful contractor must have the necessary qualifications, experience, and certifications to undertake the work. The contractor must also have the necessary equipment and personnel to complete the project.

**Evaluation Criteria**
The evaluation criteria will focus on the following:
* Qualifications and experience of the contractor
* Technical capabilities and capacity to undertake the work
* Financial capability and bonding

**Submission Instructions**
Interested contractors must submit their qualifications, including:
* Proof of certification and qualifications
* Description of similar projects undertaken
* Organization chart and personnel involved in the project
* Health and safety plan
* Environmental impact assessment and mitigation plan

**Documentation**
The tender document can be downloaded from the Canada Buy Service.

**Contact Information**
For further information and to submit qualifications, please contact:
Shawn Davis, Purchasing Agent
Environment and Climate Change Canada
 Phone: (873) 500-0215
Email: [shawn.davis@ec.gc.ca](mailto:shawn.davis@ec.gc.ca)

Note:

- As the original invitation had too many extraneous details such as phone numbers and emials, it was left for contact purposes
